name: Jordan Valley Marriott Dead Sea Resort & Spa

reviews.text: A second stay at the JVM which was every bit as faultless as the first.
reviews.title: Excellent second stay...
Lovely hotel on the Dead Sea
reviews.text: Staying over New Year, there was a fantasic party in the Ballroom with great enteratinment - something to suit all tastes. There was a ballon drop at midnight and we partied on until the small hours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent, the Steak House (Jo's) was open during my stay this time and for sure this is the best Wagyu Steak I have ever tasted. And the home-made bread! I didn't know bread could actually taste that good! Big hello to the girls in Jo's!
reviews.title: great choice to end our jordan journey

reviews.text: Il Terrazzo could still boast the best pasta outside Italy and Mosiaco buffet was lovely each time I was there. Special mention to Panos (Panagiotis Mertekis), Director of Restaurants; it is refreshing to see such impeccable service and high quality of food as uniform throughout the whole resort.
reviews.title: Loved the view!

reviews.text: I scored with the weather as it was unusually warm for the time of year so managed to laze by the pool. Laze being the operative word, didn't have to move for anything, the guys round the pool did it all.

I stayed for 2 nights on a business trip. The resort is quite large with an abundance of pools, both outdoor and indoor, excellent landscaping and areas to meander around. The rooms are spacious with all the regular amenities one can expect of a Marriott. I found the room service slow...30 minutes for a bottle of water.
reviews.title: Great location, huge Spa areas, slow service

reviews.text: WiFi is free in the lobby areas, but chargeable in the room, which is bit of a downer, considering how important WiFi is today.
reviews.title: Great resort with easy Dead Sea access

reviews.text: Food in the Italian restaurant was pretty mediocre, the all day dining, buffet breakfast was quite large with many options and the food generally good, though not excellent. Nice sports bar Champions is available for those Football lovers with a great ambience.
reviews.title: Great facilities (except the restaurants); service could be improved and...

reviews.text: The best is the huge Spa area where one can use very nicely appointed Saunas, Steam Baths, Whirlpool, an indoor fresh water pool and a indoor Dead Sea pool filled with the water from the Dead Sea. If you want to float around without getting worried about stepping on rocks, then this is a good option. There is a paid option as well if you want to use the other features of the spa.
reviews.title: Lively atmosphere and great facilities

reviews.text: All in all, a good resort considering there are not many choices around.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful facility with excellent service. Security is tight and if you want to photograph with a long lens expect security to descend upon you. Wireless internet is an additional charge at 15 JD/24 hours for highspeed (it performed as advertised). If you plan to float the Dead Sea, you will be provided plastic water shoes (no extra expense) and towels. There are wooden changing cabanas and rinse showers at the shore. (Tip: Try to float the Dead Sea when there is the least amount of wind. The shoreline is rocky. Since it's difficult to control your float, the waves caused by wind will carry you against the rocks when you return to shore. You might experience some minor scrapes.) We were surprised that we didn't feel all that chilled floating the Dead Sea in December. After you rinse from the Dead Sea, relax in the hotel's heated pool.
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't usually recommend hotel souvenir shops, but the Marriott did have a nice one near the entrance. The salesman was attentive without being pushy. Items were of a higher quality and more reasonably priced than anything we saw in Madaba.
reviews.title: Perfect spot for visiting the Dead Sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last but not least, room service was excellent. The Marriott definitely pampers its guests.
reviews.title: Tough to beat, and close to convention center
Happy
reviews.text: I stayed two nights after New Year at this Marriott as we could not find any reasonable Hotel on the other side in Israel. We crossed the border from Eilat and took a rental car from Thrifty in Aqaba. Crossing border was very easy (and a complete different experience than in Tel Aviv). The only rip off was the taxi that you must take on the Aquaba side - about 11 JOD to the rental station. From there it was an easy drive to the hotel. You have to calculate about 3.5 hours, even though the distance is not that far. But you can´t go much faster on this sometimes busy road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you come close to the northern end of the Dead Sea, there is only one area with the typical international hotels....The Mövempick, Hilton, Holiday In, Crown Plaza and of course the Marriott.
reviews.title: Watch sunset on Aaron/Moses Mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent location overlooking the Dead sea. We could not fault our stay in the Marriott, & we could go no forever about the friendly service & delicious food. Needless to say we were spoilt rotten & put on weight!
reviews.title: The Oasis you search for

reviews.text: This hotel and spa has a lot to offer, even on a rare stormy day. My husband and I enjoyed the dead sea mud facial (me) and Swedish massage (him). Once you book a treatment, you can use the spa facilities for 'free'. Otherwise it's 15 JD. We liked the saltwater pool, warm pool, and jacuzzi w jets. Only complaint was the cost of the food at the restaurants. You are a captive audience. They wouldn't even serve us tap water when we requested it. Instead they poured 6 JD Italian water (big bottle) or 3JD Evian (small bottle). However, even though it was pricey, the food at the Italian restaurant was good.
reviews.title: Lovely Spa Facilities, Nice Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a delightful night at the Marriott Dead Sea. The location and grounds were very pleasant, the room comfortable and the food, particularly at the Italian restaurant, of high quality. Staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with own Dead Sea beach

reviews.text: It is a very good place to relax for a couple of days, though I would get bored after that as there is nothing else in the area except other smart hotels. Swimming, or rather, floating in the Dead Sea is a wonderful experience that is difficult to describe.
reviews.title: Ace place!

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and were very happy with this hotel. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was very comprehensive. The pool that was open (this was winter) was body temperature and a pleasure to remain in for hours! The access to the dead sea was through interesting gardens and sandles were supplied for your dip in the dead sea. Lovely experience that you shouldn't miss. The happy hour at the Acacia, 5 - 7 pm, was much needed as the other food and drink options were pretty pricey. Lovely resort overall and very conducive to relaxation - there is not much else to do but relax!
reviews.title: Excellent Managed Hotel in the ME

reviews.text: I am currently staying at the hotel and it is my first night (planning to stay for 2 nights) . The hotel is nice, clean and there are enough pools and restaurants, but unfortunately the service is not good enough. For example I was with my wife and we have been told that there is a nice place where you can enjoy your time listening to music and watch a belly dancer, we went to the place and we asked one of the guys to find us a table but he told us that there is no free table. Fine how about if we want to book one for next day, but unprofessionally he said no booking you have to come before 7 pm and sit on a table!! How about if we wait? He said you have to jump on any free table and book it? This is a 5 stars hotel! The customer should find the table. Another example, we went to one of the known restaurants in the hotel , we called the waiter to be seated but he ignored us until we went to him and told him that I am going to complain !! I hope the 2nd will be better and we will have a better experience !
reviews.title: Nice rooms and good in general but as usual BAD SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at the Marriott Dead Sea few days ago. Booked the Sudio suite. Reception was great and helpful. I asked for a smoking suite through my online reservation and it wasn't ready. The front desk offered me a non-smoking room which I accepted but didn't want later. They were very gracious and showed me two more suites and I chose one. I finally checked in when the suite was ready.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: I have been to this hotel several times before, but for a day trip to the pool. This was the first time I spend the night. The hotel is nice, the pools are clean and fun. The staff are great. They go all the way to please you. I dined there since there is absolutely nothing to do outside the hotel. The food was good and I truly enjoyed my one nighter.
reviews.title: outstanding place

reviews.text: One drawback though, the breakfast buffet was nice but not rich. They can offer more diverse and continental items.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel on the coast of Death Sea

reviews.text: Recommended for those who seek peace and solitude.
reviews.title: Daily belly dance on the hour in the evenings

reviews.text: I doubt I have been to a resort or hotel which has offered such an incredible standard of personal customer care. This in turn makes me somewhat bemused if not amused by the comments of poor service. Anyway, I shall break this into categories for an easy read!
reviews.title: Fantastically Faultless...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival
reviews.title: Not as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival I was met by door staff who were courteous and friendly. Bags are scanned through an airport-type security system which took only minutes. Check in was fast, efficient and I was in my room in no time at all.
reviews.title: Number 1 hotel in Dead sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Hotel - 5 star

reviews.text: I booked a standard room so I am not sure if I was upgraded or not but I was more than pleasantly surprised by the room I was given (no 549). It was spacious, perfectly clean with a large balcony overlooking the main pool, down the resort and out to the Dead Sea. Rest room and facilities were perfect, AC magnificent, free water provided every day with ice machines conveniently located on the floor.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Outstanding Service

reviews.text: Hi guys!I have just ended my stay with Marriott Dead sea in Jordan and I can share with u my experience:
reviews.title: Great hotel on the dead sea priced like The Ritz in Paris!I am serious!
Isolated setting on the vast expanse of the Dead Sea
reviews.text: Location:5stars,on the shores of the Dead Sea,opposite Israel.

Geographical expl.:hotel on the highest terrace of the hill that represents the shoreline,the beach for sunbathing one level below,the actual shoreline without sand but with beautifully coloured rocks and with the famous treatment mud one more level below.
reviews.title: Awesome location but cleanliness is a major issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness:5stars
reviews.title: Delightful resort en route to Petra

reviews.text: Restaurants:the usual Marriott brands with great quality of food and appropriate service.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an ideal place to stay if you're planning on visiting the Dead Sea. I looked around the nearby hotels (were looking to eat dinner there) and am convinced this is the best in the area. There do not seem to be any smaller and more individually designed hotels - so, as far as big hotel chains go - this is a high standard.
reviews.title: Best in the area

reviews.text: The rooms are fine and clean and the service was impeccable, but it's really the pool and the Dead Sea itself, which makes this hotel special. The pool is divided into several areas and levels which makes it easy to find a quiet corner if you are not there with your family. You can, however, feel a bit isolated as there aren't really any other places to go in the evening, but just as well as the food was fine, but don't come here thinking you're going to be going out in the evenings.
reviews.title: Private beach to dead sea

reviews.text: Two pieces of advice, which when considering them as I write them down are pretty obvious: 1: Don't trust locals telling you that you can't get burned in the sun due to the depth at which the Dead Sea is located and 2: Don't shave immediately before going into the Dead Sea... it is made of salt... ouch!
reviews.title: Amazing location and service
Superb
reviews.text: We stayed in duplex suite .. Did not like room layout because we could not being luggages to our room on the second floor as stairs too narrow .. 2 rooms on the 2 nd floor so we have to go up and down to get changed .. Not a good practice.. Ask for a view of dead sea which wad beautiful ... Access to beach was easy and a few restaurants in the hotel ( champion bar offered good burger ) .. Buffet was a little steep considering not many restaurants in the area.. Bfast was oke as well .. Internet is not free Jod10 for 24 hours

We stayed at this hotel from 30th of December till the 1st of January. We were scheduled to stay for only one night. We decided to extend our stay by one additional day after seeing the location and the quality of the resort. These folks were completely booked solid due to 31st December party. I spoke to the front desk manager -- Laith Naber -- and he assured me that he would spare no effort in getting us the additional night. He did not disappoint. As I was a Lifetime Platinum, I was upgraded to a junior suite. I was able to stay in the same room for the second day and while I was not able to use points for the additional day, they charged me rate for a regular room. I was pleasantly taken aback by the front desks desire to help me out -- just amazing service. The reason I have given them average rating on the value is the cost of alcohol -- ~9 JD (12 USD) for a large beer.
reviews.title: Great stay - wish it was longer!

aka: Jordan Valley Marriott Resort And Spa
description: The Jordan Valley Marriott Dead Sea Resort & Spa, Jordan's hospitality ambassador of life's healing grounds is surrounded by rugged purple mountains that subtly change in color as the day unfolds. This is where the spirit of Jordan fills the air and the pulse of history resonates in culture with an endless celebration of life and traditions. The Resort offers anticipatory and warm service that revives the soul, as well as a self contained blend of modern décor and generous space. Service is unparalleled, anticipating every need and the culinary delights are a pleasure to enjoy. The "Spa" is an integral part of the resort. It offers a retreat for guests to unwind, relax and rejuvenate and is designed to offer guests a unique experience and to help re-balance the body, mind and spirit. The treatments are specially prepared to invigorate the body and soul. In addition, the Jordan Valley Marriott Resort & Spa is proud to be the first hotel in the Middle East to switch to solar panel energy for hot water.
